page.title: 02LANDSCAPE.
page.content: The land is drained by small streams, which flow eastwards to the River Teme. They are Wylcwm Brook,Gwernaffel Brook, Cwm Gilla and Little Cwm Gilla. The Woodhouse Reservoir is a recent construction by the Welsh Water Authority (Wye Division) in Woodhouse Lane. It holds 100,000 galls. and supplies water to Knighton and District. Under farmland and near Woodhouse Lane by "Lady's Wood", is a tunnel pipe bringing water from the Elan Valley Reservoirs of Central Wales for Birmingham at the rate of 80,000,000galls. a day. It crosses a brook by an aquaduct. There are many springs in the area. Most farms have their own well. "Jacket's Well", near Knighton, was until recently, one of Knighton's chief souces of water.
